senses.synonym: 13658855-n (the basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites; \""a typical household circuit carries 15 to 50 amps\""

relations.target: current=00669281-a (occurring in or belonging to the present time; \""current events\""; \""the current topic\""; \""current negotiations\""; \""current psychoanalytic theories\""; \""the ship's current position\"");07421365-n (a steady flow of a fluid (usually from natural causes); \""the raft floated downstream on the current\""; \""he felt a stream of air\""; \""the hose ejected a stream of water\"");08478606-n (dominant course (suggestive of running water) of successive events or ideas; \""two streams of development run through American history\""; \""stream of consciousness\""; \""the flow of thought\""; \""the current of history\"");11463628-n (a flow of electricity through a conductor; \""the current was measured in amperes\""

ampere=13658855-n (the basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites; \""a typical household circuit carries 15 to 50 amps\"");13659320-n (a former unit of electric current (slightly smaller than the SI ampere)

senses.definition: ampere, the unit of electrical current
